      static boolean checkPrice(java.lang.String priceRange, int index)

      Checks if the string is a number or not, returns true if it is, returns false if it gives an error
      static void Search(javax.swing.JTextArea searchText, java.lang.String strKeyWord, java.lang.String strSymbol, java.lang.String strLowPrice, java.lang.String strHighPrice)
      Searches using 3 different option which can be used interchangebly or together Search by symbol = Matches symbol and returns list Search by Keywords = Overrides symbol and matches based on key words without case being sensitive, and also matches based on price Search by price = depending on the range user enters, it will search based on price ranges between the 2 values

      • Buy

        public static void Buy(javax.swing.JTextArea buyText,
                       int userChoice,
                       java.lang.String strQuantity,
                       java.lang.String strPrice,
                       java.lang.String symbol,
                       java.lang.String name)
                throws PortfolioException
        The buy function that adds an object of Investment into the arrayList and hashMap!
        Parameters:
        buyText - : pointer to the textArea to output messages
        userChoice - : the type of investment user is currently buying
        strQuantity - : the quantity of the investment user is currently buying
        strPrice - : the price of the investment user is currently buying
        symbol - : the symbol of the investment user currently is buying
        name - : the name of the investment user currently is buying
        Throws:
        PortfolioException - custom exception

        sellText - : pointer to the textArea for messages to be outputed
        strQuantity - : quantity of investment the user is going to sell
        strPrice - : price of investments the user is going to sell
        symbol - : symbol of the investment user is going to sell
        Throws:
        PortfolioException - custom exceptions

      • Search

        public static void Search(javax.swing.JTextArea searchText,
                          java.lang.String strKeyWord,
                          java.lang.String strSymbol,
                          java.lang.String strLowPrice,
                          java.lang.String strHighPrice)
                   throws PortfolioException
        Searches using 3 different option which can be used interchangebly or together Search by symbol = Matches symbol and returns list Search by Keywords = Overrides symbol and matches based on key words without case being sensitive, and also matches based on price Search by price = depending on the range user enters, it will search based on price ranges between the 2 values
        Parameters:
        searchText - : pointer to textArea to output all matches found
        strKeyWord - : key words for names to search for in the list
        strSymbol - : symbol to search for in the list
        strLowPrice - : lower limit of price range
        strHighPrice - : upper limit of price range
        Throws:
        PortfolioException - Algorithm for using hash maps : Goes through the hashmap list and retrieves the indexes of the key words Checks if any key words intersect with one another A second array is created containing only the intersections The second array is used to grab the indexes and output information based on the users filters!

      • isNumber

        public static boolean isNumber(java.lang.String test)
        Checks if the string is a number or not, returns true if it is, returns false if it gives an error
        Parameters:
        test - : the string to be tested whether it is a string or a integer!
        Returns:
        returns whether it is a number or not

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • checkPrice

        public static boolean checkPrice(java.lang.String priceRange,
                                 int index)
        Checks the format of the price range, ie : -15 means 0 to 15, 15- means 15 and Higher, 15-20 means 15 to 20, etc returns the true if it matches, rerturns false if its not in between price range
        Parameters:
        priceRange - contains the the string entered by the user for price ranges
        index - contains the index of the stock/mutualfund currently being checked for price
        Returns:
        whether it falls in range of the price range
